Consider the functionality: PDF, RDF, Graphics2D, PNG, TIFF, and so on. All good
stuff to be sure, but all stuff that has absolutely nothing to do with XML. Why
then is it called "XMLGraphics"? Because the two specific projects that spawned
this library use it to do XMLish things like SVG and XSL-FO, which is also fine;
but this library itself is not about XML and shouldn't be called XML graphics.

I'm not sure what it shoudl be called: maybe just Apache Graphics Commons? Or
perhaps  Apache Graphics Formats? However, it's really not about XML at all.
creator: elharo@metalab.unc.edu
jeremias@apache.org
text:
Well, our project here project is called "Apache XML Graphics". "Commons" is a
subproject, like FOP and Batik. Since there are other "Commons" (Jakarta
Commons, WS-Commons, XML Commons etc.) at Apache we need to give it a unique
name and that incidentally has "XML" in it. Batik and FOP are very much about
XML. XML Graphics Commons happens to have just one component (XMP) which deals
with XML.

I personally think the name is ok. Changing the name will also produce quite
some unattractive work. You can try to convince everyone that a different name
is necessary. But please do this on general@xmlgraphics.apache.org, not in Bugzilla.

(I'm going to forward this to the mailing list.)
